comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: " ... ... The Hood carried on well up towards Fort Denison before swooping around to Kirribilli. On reaching her anchorage the huge anchor, with its massive chain, dropped with a mighty roar and rattle. There was a great splash when the anchor touched the water, and a cloud of rust rose like a red smoke from the chain as it rattled out. ... " From - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16145520, part of several pages in the SMH 10/4/1924 with reports and photos starting on p.11 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1227276

comment.author: 96001101@N06
comment._content: 黑白照片的感觉十分的精美，岁月感十足。

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Nice one! Thanks for those beachcomber, such a brilliant illustration of the event. :)

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/96001101@N06] 我們很高興你喜歡他們  (via GoogleTranslate)

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Yes, I thought it was worth posting - strange how a small detail like the "cloud of rust" makes a huge difference to the description.
